I need to modify this so that clicking the parent label navigates to the overview page while still maintaining the dropdown functionality on hover/click.

      &gt;

+           // If there&#39;s no href or it&#39;s just &quot;#&quot;, prevent navigation and toggle dropdown
+           if (!group.href || group.href === &quot;#&quot;) {
+             e.preventDefault();
+             setOpen(v =&gt; !v);
+           }
+         }}
        &gt;

---

Perfect! I've successfully updated the Navbar component to make the parent links clickable. Here's what I changed:

## Changes Made

1. **Converted buttons to links**: Changed the `<button>` element to a `<Link>` component for parent navigation items that have children.

2. **Smart click handling**: Added an `onClick` handler that:
   - Navigates to the overview page when the parent link has a valid `href` (like `/product`, `/company`, `/solutions`, etc.)
   - Prevents navigation and toggles the dropdown only when there's no valid `href` or it's just a placeholder "#"

3. **Maintained existing functionality**: The dropdown still works on hover and the visual styling remains the same.

## How it works now

- **Product**: Clicking "Product" will navigate to `/product` (the overview page)
- **Company**: Clicking "Company" will navigate to `/company` (the overview page)  
- **Solutions**: Clicking "Solutions" will navigate to `/solutions` (the overview page)
- **Legal**: Clicking "Legal" will navigate to `/legal` (the overview page)

The dropdown functionality is preserved - hovering still shows the dropdown menu, and clicking on child items still works as expected. The navigation data already had the correct `href` values set, so no changes were needed there.

Now when users click on parent navigation items like "Product", they'll be taken to the product overview page (`/product`) just like how "Pricing" takes them to `/pricing`.
